title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Beck M (2025). slrcsap: Lightweight Tools Create Sea Level Rise Predictions Tampa Bay Region. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/tbep-tech/slrcsap.
code: @Manual{,   title = {slrcsap: Lightweight Tools to Create Sea Level Rise Predictions for the Tampa Bay Region},   author = {Marcus Beck},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/tbep-tech/slrcsap}, }

what: Lightweight Tools to Create Sea Level Rise Predictions for the Tampa Bay Region
title: Lightweight Tools to Create Sea Level Rise Predictions for the Tampa Bay Region
text: R package create projections sea level rise Tampa Bay region recommended Climate Science Advisory Panel

what: Get Sea Level Rise (SLR) scenario — get_scenario
title: Get Sea Level Rise (SLR) scenario — get_scenario
Get Sea Level Rise (SLR) scenario — get_scenario
code: get_scenario(   id = 520,   scenario = c("IntLow", "Int", "IntHigh"),   method = "curl",   quiet = TRUE )

title: Get Sea Level Rise (SLR) scenario — get_scenario
text: id numeric, gauge number. Default 520 (St. Petersburg, FL). scenario character, SLR scenario. Default 'IntLow', 'Int', 'IntHigh' (NOAA Intermediate Low, Intermediate, Intermediate High). See details available options. method character, download method. Default 'curl', passed download.file(). quiet logical, suppress download messages. Default TRUE.

title: Get Sea Level Rise (SLR) scenario — get_scenario
text: data frame columns id, scenario, year, SLR meters, SLR feet.

title: Get Sea Level Rise (SLR) scenario — get_scenario
text: Information https://sealevel.nasa.gov/task-force-scenario-tool?psmsl_id={gauge}. Results SLR mm feet intermediate low, intermediate, intermediate high scenarios default based recommended scenarios Climate Science Advisory Panel.  Full options scenarios 'Low', 'IntLow', 'Int', 'IntHigh', 'High'. Values SLR relative change 2020.

title: Get Sea Level Rise (SLR) scenario — get_scenario
code: dat <- get_scenario() head(dat) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>      id scenario               year slr_m slr_ft #>   <dbl> <fct>                 <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1   520 NOAA Intermediate Low  2020 0.113  0.372 #> 2   520 NOAA Intermediate Low  2030 0.180  0.592 #> 3   520 NOAA Intermediate Low  2040 0.250  0.821 #> 4   520 NOAA Intermediate Low  2050 0.322  1.06  #> 5   520 NOAA Intermediate Low  2060 0.392  1.29  #> 6   520 NOAA Intermediate Low  2070 0.463  1.52

what: Get monthly Mean Sea Level (MSL) data for selected gauge — get_sealevel
title: Get monthly Mean Sea Level (MSL) data for selected gauge — get_sealevel
text: Get monthly Mean Sea Level (MSL) data selected gauge

title: Get monthly Mean Sea Level (MSL) data for selected gauge — get_sealevel
Get monthly Mean Sea Level (MSL) data for selected gauge — get_sealevel
text: gauge numeric, gauge number. Default 8726520 (St. Petersburg, FL).

title: Get monthly Mean Sea Level (MSL) data for selected gauge — get_sealevel
text: data frame columns gauge, year, month, date, MSL meters, MSL feet.

title: Get monthly Mean Sea Level (MSL) data for selected gauge — get_sealevel
text: Information https://tidesandcurrents.noaa.gov using URL https://tidesandcurrents.noaa.gov/sltrends/data/{gauge}_meantrend.txt.  Results monthly Mean Sea Level (MSL) meters feet, seasonal cycle removed.

title: Get monthly Mean Sea Level (MSL) data for selected gauge — get_sealevel

what: Plot sea level scenario data — plot_scenario
title: Plot sea level scenario data — plot_scenario
Plot sea level scenario data — plot_scenario
code: plot_scenario(   dat,   cols = c("deepskyblue", "orange", "red"),   units = "ft",   linewidth = 1,   caption = TRUE,   title = TRUE,   subtitle = "Gauge 8726520, St. Petersburg, FL",   xrng = c(2020, 2100),   xbrk = 10,   yrng = c(0, 6),   ybrk = 1 )

title: Plot sea level scenario data — plot_scenario
text: dat Input data get_scenario(). cols character, color palette lines. Default c('deepskyblue', 'orange', 'red'). units character, units y-axis. Default 'ft'. Options 'ft' 'm'. linewidth numeric, line width. Default 1. caption logical, add caption source. Default TRUE. title logical, add title. Default TRUE. subtitle character, subtitle plot. Default 'Gauge 8726520, St. Petersburg, FL'. Use NULL omit. xrng numeric, x-axis range. Default c(2020, 2100). xbrk numeric, x-axis breaks. Default 10. yrng numeric, y-axis range. Default c(0, 6). ybrk numeric, y-axis breaks. Default 1.

title: Plot sea level scenario data — plot_scenario
Plot sea level scenario data — plot_scenario
code: dat <- get_scenario() plot_scenario(dat) #> Warning: Removed 15 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_line()`).

title: Plot sea level data — plot_sealevel
Plot sea level data — plot_sealevel
code: plot_sealevel(   dat,   col = "deepskyblue",   units = "ft",   caption = TRUE,   xrng = NULL,   xbrk = 10,   yrng = c(-1, 1),   ybrk = 0.5 )

title: Plot sea level data — plot_sealevel
text: dat Input data get_sealevel(). col character, color line. Default 'deepskyblue'. units character, units y-axis. Default 'ft'. Options 'ft' 'm'. caption logical, add caption source. Default TRUE. xrng Date, x-axis range. Default NULL, uses range data. xbrk numeric, x-axis breaks. Default 10. yrng numeric, y-axis range. Default c(-1, 1). ybrk numeric, y-axis breaks. Default 0.5.

title: Plot sea level data — plot_sealevel
Plot sea level data — plot_sealevel
